availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson Fletcher (Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee, attorney and Tennessee Secretary of State)

body.p: Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee, attorney and Tennessee Secretary of State. Carter County, Tennessee, native. Son of John and Leah Fletcher. Married to Catherine Drake Fletcher in Carter County, Tennessee, on December 10, 1840. Father of Mary C. Fletcher, Emma J. Fletcher, James R. Fletcher, and Ada L. Fletcher. Married to Emma E. Fletcher in 1860. Father of Andrew Fletcher, Sarah Fletcher, and Rosa R. Fletcher. Attorney in Cocke County, Tennessee, in 1850. Attorney in Greene County, Tennessee, in 1860. Secretary of State of the State of Tennessee from 1865 to 1870.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Cocke County, District 11, p. 344A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Greene County, District 10, p. 287.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Bradley County, District 10, p. 365B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Carter County, 1796-1950: Marriage Index.
Oliver B. Temple, Notable Men of Tennessee from 1833 to 1875: Their Times and Their Contemporaries (New York: The Cosmopolitan Press, 1912), 123-127.
"Andrew Jackson Fletcher (1820-1870)," Find A Grave, Memorial 27372013, accessed April 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27372013.
